entry.title: Ocoee salamander (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Ocoee salamander (example pictured) from Tennessee is named after the Cherokee word for Passiflora incarnata (passionflower)?

entry.title: North Carolina state auditor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the North Carolina state auditor is fifth in the line of succession to the governorship of North Carolina?

entry.title: Martini Maccomo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Martini Maccomo accidentally shot someone in the eye while performing?

entry.title: Conceited (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that on the song "Conceited", Flo Milli raps that she's been important since she was a fetus?

entry.title: the world's largest producer of pure lithium (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the heads of the world's largest producer of pure lithium grew up in poverty?

entry.title: William F. Hanson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that William F. Hanson collaborated with Zitkala-Sa on a Sioux-inspired work called The Sun Dance Opera?

entry.title: Weesperplein metro station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the platform below the Weesperplein metro station was used as a fallout shelter after the line that was supposed to run through it got cancelled?

entry.title: Beatrice Muller (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Beatrice Muller lived on Queen Elizabeth 2 for nine years?
